channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Affirmative Action News Is Coming
item.description: We’re covering college admissions after the Supreme Court’s decision.

item.title: Polio Vaccination Campaign in Gaza Faces Big Hurdles
item.description: The operation depends on brief pauses in fighting in a war zone where the rule of law has broken down and hundreds of thousands of people are living i...

item.title: Why Relief Agencies Are Rushing Polio Vaccines to Gaza
item.description: A wider outbreak in the conflict zone would be difficult to contain and could spread far, experts fear.

item.title: In South Indian Cinema, a #MeToo Reckoning Comes Roaring Back
item.description: A report withheld since 2019 has finally been released, providing damning evidence of sexual misconduct and gender discrimination in Malayalam cinema.

item.title: Gaza Fighting to Pause for Polio Vaccinations, and Harris’s CNN Interview
item.description: Plus, complacency as Covid cases surge.

item.title: Battling Mpox in the Outbreak’s Epicenter in Congo
item.description: An early look at a remote treatment center where children and adults suffer with mpox, recently declared a global health emergency.

item.title: Inmate Revolts Highlight Failings and Miseries of Russian Prisons
item.description: Staff shortages, beatings, corruption and harsh treatment of Muslim prisoners have all led to unrest among inmates, with recent uprisings turning dead...

item.title: Gazan Mother ‘Shocked’ After Finding Out Her Son Has Polio
item.description: An infant boy is the first confirmed case of polio in Gaza in 25 years. The World Health Organization and the United Nations are now working to stop t...

item.title: Boar’s Head Plant Tied to 9 Listeria Deaths Had Mold, Leaky Pipes and Flies
item.description: Federal inspectors cited continuing problems at a deli meat plant in Virginia that was linked to an outbreak of listeria, records indicate.

item.title: Inmate Revolts Highlight Failings and Miseries of Russian Prisons
item.description: Staff shortages, beatings, corruption and harsh treatment of Muslim prisoners have all led to unrest among inmates, with recent uprisings turning dead...
